ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ na pɔ̀ɔn ya?
en: What did you do with that bag?

ngiemboon: Yàa! Á kɔ́ gie ɔ̀ gÿo pɛ́ʼɛ̀?
en: “Yaa”! What are you doing like that?
Here are these bags, carried for him .

ngiemboon: Apɔ̀ɔn Tâm pɔ́ ye míŋ we té poŋ.
en: Tam's bag and that of her child are not good.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ pfǒ ye nzɔ̌ tá ńgwɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn.
en: Where did you go before getting here?

ngiemboon: Tà á pɔ́ɔn lékaa káŋ yɔ́ɔn, à kaa pɔ́ yé.
en: Let him not carry my plate, let him carry his own.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ la lúɔ pɔ̀ɔn yé á lʉʼ.
en: I asked for his bag, he refused.

ngiemboon: Yê! Yɛ̂ kɔ́ gie ɔ̀ gÿo tà á sẅíʼi nzẅìŋ gú?
en: Hey! What do you do so well that it degrades you?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńjú mbab, ɔ̀ ná yeg.
en: If you buy the meat, you give ours.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ nǎa pɔ̀ɔn yɔ́b. Náa yég yég.
en: You gave them the bag. Give ours too.

ngiemboon: Tè nyé ŋwàʼne gí, ḿbíi yég.
en: Don't leave your letter to read ours.

ngiemboon: Tè tóŋo ŋwàʼne yé, tóŋ pɔ́ yégè.
en: Don't read his letter, just read ours.
